document.docAuthor: Xu, Deliang, Webb, Michael D., Shang, Suqin & Zhang, Yalin
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Pacific leafhopper genus Hecaloidella (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae Deltocephalinae: Selenocephalini) with description of sixteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Pacific leafhopper genus Hecaloidella (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae Deltocephalinae: Selenocephalini) with description of sixteen new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to species and species groups of
Hecaloidella
(excluding H. brunifasciata )

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Vertex with distinct longitudinal or oblique striations at least to anterior transverse sulcus; pronotum with distinct transverse striations; forewing with outer subapical cell tapered basally ( Figs. 2B , 3D ); aedeagus disassociated from connective (
H. nitida
species group
)....................................................................................... 2
- Vertex spots not extending to fore margin; forewing not as above; aedeagus with basal ventral process not spine-like...... 5

5 Connective caudal extension with a long basal ventral process ( Fig. 4C )...............................
H. caudospina

- Connective caudal extension without a basal ventral process ( Fig. 4H ).................................
H. nudapenis

- Pronotum and mesonotum not marked as above; aedeagus associated with connective (
H. borneoensis
species group
)..... 7
8 Aedeagus with either a single very small subapical process dorsally or two pair of apical processes.................... 9

9 Aedeagus with a single small subapical process ( Fig. 6F )............................................
H. brevispina

- Aedeagus with two pair of apical processes ( Fig. 6M ).............................................
H. quadrispina

10 Aedeagal shaft less than twice as long as height of atrium ( Fig. 6D )...................................
H. brevipenis

11 Aedeagus with gonopore arising near mid-length of shaft ( Fig. 6I )....................................
H. longipenis

- Aedeagus with gonopore arising two thirds distance to apex of shaft ( Fig. 6B )..........................
H. borneoensis

- Connective without posterior extension ( Fig. 7D )......................................................
H. brevis

- Aedeagus with two pairs of apical processes ( Fig. 8F )...........................................
H. sandakanensis
